channel.title: windbg on minidump.net
channel.description: Recent content in windbg on minidump.net

item.title: Writing native WinDbg extensions in C#
item.description: Using NativeAOT and ClrMD to write a native WinDbg extension in .NET.

item.title: Finding an instance of thread by id in WinDbg
item.description: How to find an instance of System.Threading.Thread by id in WinDbg, with a .NET Core memory dump.

item.title: Reading AsyncLocal values from a memory dump
item.description: This article explains how AsyncLocal values are stored in .NET and how to retrieve them from a memory dump.

item.title: An unconventional way of investigating a NullReferenceException
item.description: Digging into a bug in the .NET ARM64 runtime, learning about dispatch stubs, and using that knowledge to diagnose a NullReferenceException.

item.title: Debugging a native deadlock in a .NET Linux application
item.description: This story begins when one of our integrations tests started got stuck on one PR that seemingly impacted unrelated code. This is a nice excuse to cover some concepts I haven’t touched in my previous articles, such as downloading the .NET symbols on Linux.

item.title: AccessViolation in ObjectNative::IsLockHeld (part 2 of 2)
item.description: This is the second part of an investigation where I tried to understand why an application was randomly crashing with an AccessViolationException. This part starts when, as I ran out of easy things to try, I decided to map the assembly code of the IsLockHeld method to the original C++ code to understand exactly where it crashed.

item.title: AccessViolation in ObjectNative::IsLockHeld (part 1 of 2)
item.description: Investigating a crash in a .NET application, caused by an AccessViolationException when inspecting the state of a lock.

item.title: Investigating an InvalidProgramException from a memory dump (part 3 of 3)
item.description: In this series of article, we’re retracing how I debugged an InvalidProgramException, caused by a bug in the Datadog profiler, from a memory dump sent by a customer. This is the last part of the investigation, about figuring out what is wrong with the IL code.

item.title: Investigating an InvalidProgramException from a memory dump (part 2 of 3)
item.description: In this series of article, we’re retracing how I debugged an InvalidProgramException, caused by a bug in the Datadog profiler, from a memory dump sent by a customer. In this part, we extract the dynamic IL from the memory dump.

item.title: Investigating an InvalidProgramException from a memory dump (part 1 of 3)
item.description: In this series of article, we’re retracing how I debugged an InvalidProgramException, caused by a bug in the Datadog profiler, from a memory dump sent by a customer. The first part of the investigation is an introduction to using a memory dump from a .NET application to find the information you seek.

item.title: Writing ClrMD extensions for WinDbg and LLDB
item.description: Guide on how to write debugger extensions that are compatible with both WinDbg and LLDB.

item.title: Optimizing the WinDbg DML parser
item.description: The impact of using the wrong class for the job. Profiling and fixing a performance issue in WinDbg.
